Types

Registers = ref object
  values: seq[uint8]
  lookup: TableRef[string, int]

RegisterInfo = tuple[name: string, value: uint8]
Information about a single register in tuple form.

Procs

proc new_registers(registers: varargs[string]): Registers {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}

Creates a new collection of registers. All of the registers in the collection must be provided to this constructor proc; there is no facility to add more later.

The registers will be implicitly given an index (0-based) matching the order in which they appear in the argument list.

proc `[]`(registers: Registers; index: int): uint8 {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the value of a register based on the register's number. 
proc `[]`(registers: Registers; index: string): uint8 {...}{.raises: [KeyError],
    tags: [].}
Returns the value of a register based on the register's name. 
proc `[]=`(registers: Registers; index: int; value: uint8) {...}{.raises: [],
    tags: [].}
Modifies the value of a register based on the register's number. 
proc `[]=`(registers: Registers; index: string; value: uint8) {...}{.
    raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Modifies the value of a register based on the register's name. 
proc len(registers: Registers): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the number of registers in the collection. 
proc info(registers: Registers): seq[RegisterInfo] {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns a read-only view of the colleciton, including both the names and the values of each register.

Iterators

iterator items(registers: Registers): uint8 {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Iterates over the register collection, returning the values of each register. 
iterator pairs(registers: Registers): (int, uint8) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Iterates over the register collection, returning both the register's number and its value.
